intro: Symbolanthus stuebelii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that resemble those of the buttercup. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Symbolanthus stuebelii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
